scenes.text:
The night sky splits into violet fractures and every billboard flickers with one impossible glyph.
Phones, radios, and city sirens sync into a single non-human tone.
Gravity lurches upward for a heartbeat, lifting loose glass and ash from the street.
Your crew realizes first contact has already moved into occupation.

choices.label: Descend into the subway shelter
choices.fullText: Drop below street level and use abandoned transit routes as cover.
choices.stakes: Less aerial exposure, higher ambush risk in tight tunnels.

choices.label: Break into emergency comms control
choices.fullText: Fight for the comms grid before invaders lock the city narrative.
choices.stakes: Critical intel if successful, immediate target lock if detected.

scenes.text:
Floodwater ripples over tracks while red emergency strips pulse across the tunnel walls.
Mechanical scout drones drop from ceiling vents and begin scanning faces one by one.
A child cries somewhere down-platform, then the voice repeats from three directions at once.
The rail map burns itself out section by section.

choices.label: Ambush the scouts before they alert the fleet
choices.text: Ambush the scouts before they alert the fleet
choices.fullText: Destroy the local scouts and gamble on a silent kill chain.
choices.stakes: Delays pursuit if clean, triggers full hunt if noisy.

choices.label: Use maintenance tunnels to reach the reactor
choices.text: Use maintenance tunnels to reach the reactor
choices.fullText: Bypass contact and head straight for infrastructure sabotage.
choices.stakes: Strategic advantage, but one-way corridors with no fallback.

scenes.text:
Inside the command bunker, alien code crawls over every monitor like living static.
Operators lie unconscious at their stations with identical burn marks at the neck.
The city relay has fused itself into the grid and begun a final countdown.
A translated message appears: COMPLIANCE PREVENTS EXTINCTION.

choices.label: Hard-cut city power and kill the relay
choices.text: Hard-cut city power and kill the relay
choices.fullText: Crash the entire grid to sever alien command synchronization.
choices.stakes: Breaks invasion tempo, but leaves civilians blind and trapped.

choices.label: Reverse the uplink toward their mothership
choices.text: Reverse the uplink toward their mothership
choices.fullText: Hijack the channel and push a weaponized handshake upstream.
choices.stakes: High reward if accepted, instant retaliation if rejected.

scenes.text:
A sealed service tunnel begins broadcasting perfect copies of your own voices.
Each imitation begs to be rescued, each one knows details only your crew should know.
Thermal scans show no human heat signatures beyond the hatch.
The loudest voice uses your childhood nickname.

choices.label: Follow the voice beacon anyway
choices.fullText: Trust instinct over instruments and pursue the strongest signal.
choices.stakes: Could find survivors, could walk straight into mimic control.

choices.label: Mute comms and move by heat signatures
choices.text: Mute comms and move by heat signatures
choices.fullText: Cut emotional noise and navigate strictly by sensor truth.
choices.stakes: Sharper decisions, slower trust between players.

scenes.text:
A hidden reactor chamber hums with unstable blue plasma and static lightning.
The uplink beacon is seconds from syncing with warships parked in low orbit.
Metal catwalks tremble as if something massive is docking overhead.
Your choice now decides whether this city becomes a warning or a weapon.

choices.label: Overload the core immediately
choices.fullText: Trigger a full surge now and trust your crew can outrun the collapse.
choices.stakes: Maximum disruption, maximum casualties if timing is off.

choices.label: Plant delayed charges and evacuate
choices.fullText: Set a timed kill sequence and prioritize extraction over spectacle.
choices.stakes: More survivable route, lower chance to cripple command instantly.

scenes.text:
At the beacon spire apex, external speakers replay your friends' voices in perfect panic.
The lock panel in your hand controls the blast doors and the challenge uplink.
Outside the glass, silhouettes wave exactly in sync with one another.
If they are real, this saves them. If not, this ends everyone.

choices.label: Broadcast the challenge code and collapse the spire
choices.text: Broadcast the challenge code and collapse the spire
choices.fullText: Commit to the counter-signal and burn the tower before they adapt.
choices.stakes: Ends the node if true, no recovery if challenge fails.

choices.label: Open the blast doors for the voices outside
choices.text: Open the blast doors for the voices outside
choices.fullText: Choose trust in the voices and let them into the control core.

scenes.text:
The spire implodes into a white arc that shreds beacon arrays across the skyline.
Alien formations break and burn through dawn cloud cover in silent trails.
Your crew survives long enough to watch the invasion lose its shape.

You clear the blast radius seconds before delayed charges rip the reactor apart.
The shockwave folds rail tunnels and kills the uplink chain.
The city is scarred, but your crew leaves breathing.

The doors slide open and mimic drones flood the chamber without a sound.
Their eyes mirror your own faces for one impossible second.
Then the invasion signal completes and the sky answers.
